page.title: 09FARMING AROUND CLYRO.
page.content: The valley floor provides a large area of flat fertile land. This land is farmed as large commercial estates. One such farm is the{Guest {Farm at Cabalva. The farm is run by a farm manager and four other labourers. The farm is{1900 acres}but about 800 acres are worked by one of the owning family. The farm is a mixed farm with {barley or wheat}grown on large fields which makes machine working more efficient. There are{200 cows, 200 {heifers, 300 ewes, 450 lambs, 13 rams {and 4 bulls.}For winter feed hay and silage are cut. There are 2 double grain stores, 2 silage pits, 1 cow shed, 1 animal sick bay, a hay barn and a work shop. There are 6 tractors, spreaders and sprayers, baler and combine.
